pattern.name: Ratio
pattern.description:
Ratio of the two fields X and Y.
Ratio(NULL, Y) = NULL Ratio(X, NULL) = NULL Ratio(X, 0) = NULL Ratio(0, Y) = 0 Ratio(X, Y) = 100*X/Y
Note: The implementation prefers to return NULL when the ratio is ill defined. If you want to 0 instead of NULL, just add coalesce.
This pattern is slow, but produces great predictors.
NOTE: COULD HAVE BEEN EXTENDED INTO RATIOS OF AGGREGATES
pattern.example: Customers with very low (loan_duration / regular_payment_amount) are unlikely to pay the loan in time.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
